title: ScanServerSelector - Break nested interfaces into their own files
body:
Fixes #2855 

This PR follows the suggestion outlined in #2855 to break the nested interfaces in `ScanServerSelector` into their own files.

title: Improvements to AESCryptoService
body:
* Reduce Cipher.getInstance calls to once per file vs once per block
* Move wrap cipher to ThreadLocal thread
* Add flush at the end of createCryptoParameters() before returning the byte array
* Add logger and init checks

title: Source accumulo-env.sh from accumulo-cluster script
body:
Users can set env vars to control the number of tservers/sservers
started per host. accumulo-env.sh is sourced from other scripts in
bin, except accumulo-cluster. This commit adds the variables to
accumulo-env.sh (with default of 1) and modifies accumulo-cluster
to source the file like the other scripts in bin do.

title: Update version dependencies
body:
Updates the following dependencies

  - micrometer-bom 1.9.1 -> 1.9.3
  - opentelemetry-bom 1.15.0 -> 1.17.0
  - opentelemetry-bom-alpha 1.15.-alpha -> 1.17.0-alpha
  - log4j-bom 2.17.2 -> 2.18.0
  - junit-bom 5.9.0-M1 -> 5.9.0
  - gson 2.9.0 -> 2.9.1
  - error_prone_annotations 2.14.0 -> 2.15.0
  - protobuf-java 3.19.2 -> 3.21.5
  - checkstyle 10.3 -> 10.3.2

This PR does not include upgrades that may be possible with monitor / web code because other work in that area is in progress.  Inspired by issue #2891

title: Prevent null exception message in HighlyAvailableServiceInvocationHandler
Replace accumulo-cluster get_ip function with hostname -I
body:
get_ip returns a single ip address for the host, but could return
the incorrect one in the case where a host has multiple interfaces.
This commit modifies the logic to use hostname -I instead and checks
to see if the host we are looking for is in the list of returned IPs

Closes #2884

title: Print exceptions that cause the server process to exit to stderr
body:
Async Logging may not flush the exception to the file before the
process terminates. Print the error to stderr as well.

Closes #2885

title: Add JVM flag UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions to default JVM options
body:
Was recently working with a customer that was doing some performance testing. Customer was experiencing about a 10x performance decrease vs earlier testing runs. It appears that the JVM flag `-XX:+UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions` was lost between the customer test runs. Based on helping customer debug this and reading about it this JVM flag activates many performance related things to include intrinsics and inlining. To see this you can compare the output of:

    1. `java -XX:+PrintFlagsFinal -version | grep Intrinsic` and `java -XX:+PrintFlagsFinal -XX:+UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions -version | grep Intrinsic`, and
    2. `java -XX:+PrintFlagsFinal -version | grep Native`and `java -XX:+PrintFlagsFinal -XX:+UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions -version | grep Native`

body:
Remove main methods from utilities now that they are exposed through

Bumping the the spotbugs version in #2824 highlighted a synchronization issue.  This change minimizes possibly having multiple instance of GarbageCollectionLogger running as well as making sure one runs per server instance.

In #1099 there are some lists of methods that have been reported as "hot method too big".

This PR refactors some of those methods to make them smaller. After these changes, the following methods are no longer reported as "hot method too big":
* `org.apache.accumulo.core.file.rfile.RelativeKey::<init>`
* `org.apache.accumulo.core.file.rfile.RelativeKey::readFields`
* `org.apache.accumulo.server.fs.FileManager$ScanFileManager::openFiles`

The following have been refactored to reduce size, but are still being reported:
* `org.apache.accumulo.core.iteratorsImpl.system.LocalityGroupIterator::_seek`
* `org.apache.accumulo.tserver.scan.LookupTask::run`

Bumps commons-configuration2 from 2.7 to 2.8.0. [![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=org.apache.commons:commons-configuration2&package-manager=maven&previous-version=2.7&new-version=2.8.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/apache/accumulo/network/alerts).

title: checks if file already exists in accumulo-cluster create-config
body: I was playing around with the `accumulo-cluster create-config` command and accidentally blew my config away.  Thinking it would be best if this command only created the file if didn't exists.

title: Initial draft of tests
Refactor common code into PropUtil
body:
This PR takes similar logic from `NamespacePropUtil` and `TablePropUtil` and moves it into their parent class, `PropUtil`.

Fixes #2772

title: Remove synchronized modifier from NoFlushOutputStream.write
body:
Writes to the DFSLogger output stream are already synchronized
by the DFSLogger.write method. Looking at the other output streams
in the write stack (DataOutputStream, FSDataOutputStream,
BlockedOutputStream, etc.) their write methods are not synchronized.

Related to #2165

title: Wait for server process to notice property changes in MiniAccumuloClusterTest
body:
MiniAccumuloClusterTest.testPerTableClasspath is intermittently failing with
a MutationsRejectedException when the BatchWriter is closed because the TabletServer
is not seeing property changes made in the test right before the BatchWriter is
created. This change introduces a small sleep in an attempt to allow the
TabletServer to react to the configuration changes before the BatchWriter is used
in the test thread.

title: Convert table in replication.js to DataTable
body:
The PR converts the table in replication.js to a DataTable. This table is present at '/replication' in the monitor.

Here is the table before and after these changes. I hard coded example data to be returned from the rest endpoint for these examples:

before:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47725857/176509335-86b3bcc2-e4b4-4960-8d05-6e0ba18ce1b6.png)

after:
![replicationDatatable](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47725857/176509226-4469ddbf-cdb1-4ec0-9cd4-9edb42776de6.png)

title: closes #1377 - ensure all tables are checked ...
body:
... when removing references to candidates that are still in use.

This is done by getting tableIds from zookeeper at the start of the
reference scan and at the end of the reference scan.  During the
reference scans, the list of tableID is tracked.  After all candidates
that are still in use have been removed, there is a one more consitency
check to ensure we looked at all tables.

title: simplifies accumulo-cluster compactor config
body: Simplifies the cluster config yaml for compactor by removing redundant information.

title: Exception during iterator yield caused by multiple issues in LookupTask
Reduce merge overlap logging
body:
Reduce merge overlap logging by removing it from the Manager and into
the MergeInfo.overlap method. Further, only perform the logging the first
time another extent is evaluated and put into a map.

This PR changes the tables in bulkImport.js to DataTables. These changes can be viewed in the monitor at /bulkImports.

Here is the page on main:
![BulkImportOldTables](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47725857/175378405-2b517812-ee7f-402e-963e-74d33c27f899.png)

Here is the page on this branch:

Note: I hardcoded data to be present at the REST endpoint used to gather data for the "Bulk Imports" table.

The various info and features that are standard with DataTables (such as the search bar and paging) can be removed if anyone thinks that is a good idea.

title: Update Micrometer and OpenTelemetry dependencies
Address #2635 by lazy loading prop store in ServerContext

Also addresses a duplicate server configuration being create in ServerConfigurationFactory - uses the instance from the context.

body: Changes taken from https://github.com/apache/accumulo/pull/2215 with some improvements.

Add version check to ZooPropStore
body: This is the second half of splitting #2769 (first part is #2773)

title: Make auths classes in Authorizations
body: It looks like all the serialization done for `Authorizations` is done with custom methods that we have created over the years.  I am not sure why we need the interface on the class anymore.

title: Trivial: Use https in more places
body:
* Update license header template to use https (this has been discussed
  at length on the legal mailing list and elsewhere, and is an
  acceptable URL to reference the license text that the rat plugin has
  been made to support)
* Update to rat 0.14 to support https
* Find other uses of http and replace with https unless it breaks a link
  or is a namespace identifier or other situation where http is required
* Use the standardized format of the license header text for the
  markdown files and gitignore files
* Update the gitignore files to sync with each other, so they all
  suppress the same IDE files
* Remove unneeded CHECKSTYLE:ON comment in Accumulo.java
* Remove redundant license header in WholeColumnFamilyIteratorTest

title: Add delete event watcher to ServerConfigurationFactory
body:
This PR is in response to comments on https://github.com/apache/accumulo/pull/2769 - it adds the delete watcher to ServerConfigurationFactory so that configurations are removed from the local copy on prop store deletes.  

The synchronization will be handled in a separate PR.

title: Implement consistent Namespace and Table property handling
body:
TablePropUtil and NamespacePropUtil handle invalid properties differently. This update updates the two classes to handle properties in a similar manner. They both will now throw an exception on an invalid property value. 

This is the first step in what may be a multi-step process. With this change, both TablePropUtil and NamespacePropUtil are very similar and could possibly be combined into one method. I will create a follow-on ticket to look into that possibility. But I wanted to get the initial task of making them consistent completed first.

Closes #2633

title: Modify snapshot synchronization
body:
Modify the synchronization of configurations cached in the ServerConfigurationFactory with ZooKeeper.

The previous implementation leveraged the caffeine cache refresh after write capability - however, the secondary caching of configurations in the SeverConfigurationFactory makes that capability less effective. Because the secondary cache and the data versions use the secondary cache, the prop cache implementation is read less frequently. The use of data versions is an optimization for iterators that avoids any overhead from reading the entire property payload.

These changes provide the following benefits over the original implementation:
- deletions are detected and eliminate the persistent caching of configurations.
- detected changes are propagated to the prop store.
- uses lighter weight getStatus calls.
- provides jitter between calls and staggered invocations to reduce ZooKeeper load

title: Log RootTabletMetadata object creation at trace
Create Reference interface for new GC classes
body:
* Rename Reference to ReferenceFile and make it implement a Reference interface
to be used to stream both files and directories
* Create the AllVolumesDirectory class, which extends ReferenceDirectory, to be used
for the new special encoded "agcav" volume.
* Comment and clean up GC code

title: Convert table.js to DataTables
body:
This PR converts the table in table.js to a DataTable.

The table should behave the same except for one small change:

Current table:
![Screenshot from 2022-06-08 15-06-11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47725857/172941728-4ff87fe6-c6e1-4291-9886-18096a18523c.png)

Table with the changes from this PR:
![Screenshot from 2022-06-09 15-53-55](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47725857/172941899-659ecc36-4125-4e16-80f7-3cdd6c6b7bb7.png)

I broke the scans and compactions columns up into running and queued instead of having the queued compactions in the same column within the parenthesis.

title: Fix Reference in TabletGroupWatcher
body:
* Closes #2763
* Also fix the misplaced private String member tabletDir

title: Update spotbugs
body: This PR updates spotbugs-maven-plugin and adresses all the new warnings

title: Add .circleci/config.yml
Update default log configuration
body:
Change default filename and size triggering limit for rolling log files:

* Drop hour from filename to use daily logs instead of hourly
* Use 4 digit year to disambiguate between 2 digit time components
* Put year first so file names sort better and read more clearly
* Increase size trigger from 100MB to 512MB to roll less often
